com.versant
Class Db2Sfj

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.Db2Sfj

public class Db2Sfj
extends java.lang.Object

This is a Java Foreign View command that generates a Java Foreign View mapping file for database schema defined from C++ and/or Smalltalk according to the options specified.

java com.versant.Db2Sfj [-verbose] -d dbname [-w sfj-file]

[-class classname1 classname2 ....] [-usage|help]

Options:

-verbose

    Prints out verbose information during generation.

-d dbname

    The database from which the schema is to be read from for object sharing with Java.

-w sfj-file

    Specifies the fully qualified name of the sfj file to generate. The sfj file serves as an intermediary who captures the mapping between the Java Foreign View .Java source and the database schema. This file can be provided as input to the Sfj2Java Java program. If this option is not provided, the sfj file is written to standard output.
-class classname1
    Specifies the classes that need to be shared through the Java Foreign View. A list of class names can be specified, each separated by a white space character. Note that if this option is specified, Java Foreign View source is generated only for the list of classes specified and no others.
-nosuper
    Prevents automatic generation of Java Foreign View files for the super classes of any of the classes specified in the class list against the -class option. If this option is not specified, Java Foreign View files for super classes gets automatically generated.

-usage or -help<

    Prints out complete usage information for this command. This ends the command from running further.

The options are:

    -verbose
    -d dbname
    -w sfj-file
    -class classname1 classname2 ....
    -nosuper

    -usage|help
